case_vignette: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a generalized rash for 3 days. During this period, he has had severe itching and was not able to sleep well. He has also had fever, headache, and some muscle pain. Five days ago, he had a runny nose which subsided with over-the-counter medications. He returned from a camping trip 1 week ago. He attends a daycare center. The patient is at the 55th percentile for height and at the 50th percentile for weight. His temperature is 38.2°C (100.7°F), pulse is 97/min, and blood pressure is 96/60 mm Hg. Examination of the skin shows several macules, papules, and crusted lesions over his face, trunk, and extremities. There are a few fluid-filled vesicles over his abdomen and back. There is no cervical lymphadenopathy. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash all over my body, it's been very itchy, and I'm having trouble sleeping because of it. I also have a fever, a headache, and my muscles are aching.
How old are you?
I'm 4 years old.
Has anyone in your family been diagnosed with any skin conditions or allergies?
I don't know, nobody has told me about any skin conditions or allergies in the family.
Okay, have you been in contact with any new plants, animals, or substances recently?
Yes, I just came back from a camping trip a week ago.
Have you been vaccinated for any common childhood diseases?
I can't remember all my shots, but I think I've gotten the ones that I'm supposed to have so far.
Do you have any known allergies to medications or foods?
I don't know of any allergies to medications or foods that I have.
**Final Diagnosis:** Contact Dermatitis and Viral Infection

There is no known family history of skin conditions or allergies.
